name: 1.22.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes

- Made a significant [performance improvement fetching git status](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15750).
- Added a setting to [highlight the line number in the gutter](https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/pull/290) when matching brackets.
- Markdown preview panes [no longer reset their scroll position to the top](https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/pull/477) when the source is saved.
- Added a [setting for maximum line length](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14495) before soft wrapping is enforced.
- Numerous bug fixes to bundled language grammar packages.

<details>
<summary>All Changes</summary>

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

1.21.0...1.22.0-beta0

* [atom/atom#15613 - Use the Atom Beta executable to verify startup snapshots when building Beta](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15613)
* [atom/atom#15618 - FIX "softWrapped" appear twice in field extraction](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15618)
* [atom/atom#14495 - Enable MAX_SCREEN_LINE_LENGTH to now be set via a config option](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14495)
* [atom/atom#15440 - Replace pathwatcher w/ bundled watcher to catch created & rename events](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15440)
* [atom/atom#15623 - Upgrade text-buffer for destroy-after-save fix](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15623)
* [atom/atom#15627 - Wait for async onWillDestroyPaneItem handlers before destroying items](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15627)
* [atom/atom#15656 - Restore the fs.existsSync guard in Config](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15656)
* [atom/atom#15669 - :memo: Fix cursor name letter casing](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15669)
* [atom/atom#15683 - Allow atom:// urls to be opened from the command line](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15683)
* [atom/atom#15643 - Wait for async PaneContainer.onWillDestroyPaneItem listeners](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15643)
* [atom/atom#15681 - Notify when deserializing project state for missing directories](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15681)
* [atom/atom#14654 - Improve confirm documentation](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14654)
* [atom/atom#15712 - Update language-html to 0.48.0](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15712)
* [atom/atom#15740 - Restore a missing "typeof"](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15740)
* [atom/atom#15713 - Update syntax-related code to use new TextBuffer LanguageMode API (part 1)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15713)
* [atom/atom#15750 - Avoid process spawn overhead for refreshing git status](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15750)
* [atom/atom#15759 - Upgrade text-buffer and autosave to avoid spurious saves](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15759)
* [atom/atom#15692 - Pane on did change path](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15692)

## Notable Changes

- Language Server Protocol support and integration via [atom-languageclient](https://github.com/atom/atom-languageclient) and [atom-ide-ui](https://github.com/facebook-atom/atom-ide-ui).
- [New filesystem watcher API](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14853) to unify implementations and conserve system resources.
- More PR [timeline](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1105) [events](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/924) and [build status](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1084) are now available in the GitHub pane.
- [MacOS native tabs](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14711) are now supported.
- [Restored Atom's ASAR archive](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14682) to improve to improve performance in several scenarios, most notably installation on Windows.
- Lots of language-specific grammar improvements, including the [addition of TypeScript](https://github.com/atom/language-typescript).

<details>
<summary>All Changes</summary>

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

name: 1.21.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes

- Language Server Protocol support and integration via [atom-languageclient](https://github.com/atom/atom-languageclient) and [atom-ide-ui](https://github.com/facebook-atom/atom-ide-ui).
- [New filesystem watcher API](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14853) to unify implementations and conserve system resources.
- More PR [timeline](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1105) [events](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/924) and [build status](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1084) are now available in the GitHub pane.
- [MacOS native tabs](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14711) are now supported.
- [Restored Atom's ASAR archive](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14682) to improve to improve performance in several scenarios, most notably installation on Windows.
- Lots of language-specific grammar improvements, including the [addition of TypeScript](https://github.com/atom/language-typescript).

<details>
<summary>All Changes</summary>

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.20.0-beta7...v1.21.0-beta0

* [atom/atom#15183 - Fix regression re: closing tabs via middle mouse click on Linux](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15183)
* [atom/atom#14853 - Filesystem watcher API](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14853)
* [atom/atom#15186 - Upgrade atom-keymap to fix caps lock issues on Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15186)
* [atom/atom#15191 - Update github to 0.4.2](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15191)
* [atom/atom#15198 - Update document with electron version](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15198)
* [atom/atom#15214 - Update language-javascript](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15214)

## Notable Changes

* Added support for [multiple git diff views](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1016).
* Git commit messages can now be edited [in the main editor](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/896).
* Find in Project search results now include [additional context lines](https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/908).
* Added an [API for observing dock visibility](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14736).
* Fixed [middle-mouse button behavior](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15183) when closing tabs on Linux.
* CSS autocomplete [now supports PostCSS](https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-css/pull/80).
* Support has been added to bracket-matcher for [code embedded in strings](https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/pull/294).

This release features a couple of fixes related to editor rendering:

* Fixed a regression that prevented lines from being displayed correctly after destroying a marker associated with a block decoration (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15583).
* Fixed an issue that caused scrollbars to be in the wrong position when splitting an editor. (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15580)

name: 1.20.0-beta7
body:
This release features a couple of fixes related to editor rendering:

* Fixed a regression that prevented lines from being displayed correctly after destroying a marker associated with a block decoration (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15583).
* Fixed an issue that caused scrollbars to be in the wrong position when splitting an editor. (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15580)

name: 1.20.0-beta6
body:
* Fixed two issues that were causing the editor to move the cursor when clicking on scrollbars or near the viewport edges (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15515, https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15546).
* Fixed a regression that prevented the editor from scrolling with a low `editor.scrollSensitivity` config setting (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15487).
* Fixed an issue that prevented scrollbars from showing when the "Show scrollbars only when scrolling" setting was enabled on macOS (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15506).
* Fixed a rendering glitch in the editor caused by adding block decorations on invalid markers (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15503, https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15528).
* Fixed an uncaught exception that was sometimes thrown when adding block decorations on non-empty markers (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15550).
* Fixed a regression that prevented tabs from being closed on middle-click (https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/518).

* Fixed two issues that were causing the editor to move the cursor when clicking on scrollbars or near the viewport edges (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15515, https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15546).
* Fixed a regression that prevented the editor from scrolling with a low `editor.scrollSensitivity` config setting (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15487).
* Fixed an issue that prevented scrollbars from showing when the "Show scrollbars only when scrolling" setting was enabled on macOS (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15506).
* Fixed a rendering glitch in the editor caused by adding block decorations on invalid markers (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15503, https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15528).
* Fixed an uncaught exception that was sometimes thrown when adding block decorations on non-empty markers (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15550).
* Fixed a regression that prevented tabs from being closed on middle-click (https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/518).

name: 1.20.0-beta4
body:
1.20.0-beta4 fixes a number of editor-related bugs, including:

* [atom/atom#15372](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15372) - Blurry text on Windows
* [atom/atom#14765](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/14765) - File removed outside of Atom does not close tab in Atom regardless of setting
* [atom/atom#15267](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/15267) - Mac: No elevation of privilege prompt when attempting to edit files owned by root
* [atom/atom#15197](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/15197) - Linux: Middle-clicking an unsaved tab causes entire desktop to be unresponsive to clicks

<details>
<summary>All Changes</summary>

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.20.0-beta3...v1.20-beta4

* [atom/atom#15346 - Suppress default-prevented composition events on compositionstart instead of compositionupdate](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15346)
* [atom/atom#15345 - Round return values of getMaxScrollTop, getScrollHeight](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15345)
* [atom/atom#15347 - Use capture phase for mouseup handler](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15347)
* [atom/atom#15357 - Ignore scroll requests to NaN, null or undefined positions](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15357)
* [atom/atom#15359 - Fix folding for lines that contain a comment](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15359)
* [atom/atom#15367 - Set visibility: hidden on dummy scrollbars if native ones are invisible](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15367)
* [atom/atom#15228 - Upgrade text-buffer for setTextViaDiff fix](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15228)
* [atom/atom#15372 - Always round GPU layer dimensions to physical pixel boundaries](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15372)
* [atom/atom#15389 - Fix line number position when block decorations are at tile boundaries](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15389)
* [atom/atom#15384 - Fix highlight end pixel position calculation](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15384)
* [atom/atom#15378 - Drop use of GPU tiles for lines and line numbers](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15378)

### [tabs](https://github.com/atom/tabs)

v0.106.2...v0.107.0

* [atom/tabs#515 - Perform left/middle click actions on `click` instead of on `mousedown`](https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/515)

### [text-buffer](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer)

v13.0.9...v13.1.6

* [atom/text-buffer#242 - Don't consider lone CRs as line breaks in setTextViaDiff](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/242)
* [atom/text-buffer#244 - Use native text buffer to check if file is unmodified & to be deleted](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/244)
* [atom/text-buffer#246 - Restore the ability to save files owned by root on Mac](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/246)
* [atom/text-buffer#247 - Fix privilege escalation issues](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/247)

### [node-pathwatcher](https://github.com/atom/node-pathwatcher)

v7.1.0...v8.0.0

* [atom/node-pathwatcher#122 - Remove privilege escalation functionality](https://github.com/atom/node-pathwatcher/pull/122)

### [superstring](https://github.com/atom/superstring)

v2.0.10...v2.0.12

* [atom/superstring#24 - Avoid changing buffers' modified status when saves fail](https://github.com/atom/superstring/pull/24)

</details>

name: 1.20.0-beta1
body:
- Fix bug in Windows installer that prevented our friendly beta community from using Atom 1.20 beta on Windows (atom/atom#15194)
- Fix issues with <kbd>caps lock</kbd> interfering with keybindings on Windows (https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/216)

name: 1.20.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes

* Added support for [multiple git diff views](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1016).
* Git commit messages can now be edited [in the main editor](https://github.com/atom/github/pull/896).
* Find in Project search results now include [additional context lines](https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/908).
* Added an [API for observing dock visibility](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14736).
* Fixed [middle-mouse button behavior](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15183) when closing tabs on Linux.
* Support has been added to bracket-matcher for [code embedded in strings](https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/pull/294).

## Notable Changes

* Atom's underlying text buffer has been [implemented in native C++](https://github.com/atom/superstring)
* [Full rewrite](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13880) of the editor's rendering layer
* [Update to Electron 1.6.9](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696)
* [Render line number gutter without numbers when showLineNumbers is false](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14694)
* [Improved clarity of Editor not responding actions](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14753)
* [Restore ability for `escape` to return focus to center](https://github.com/atom/tree-view/pull/1127)
* [Optimize trailing whitespace removal using native buffer search](https://github.com/atom/whitespace/pull/157)

name: 1.19.0-beta7
body:
### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

- Ensure custom gutter decoration elements fill their container (atom/atom#15147)

### [github](https://github.com/atom/github)

v0.3.3...v0.3.4-0

- Reduce CPU usage for large repositories (https://github.com/atom/github/issues/959)
- Respect `GIT_AUTHOR_*`/`GIT_COMMITTER_*` environment variables (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/925)
- Fix screenshots in package settings (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1006)
- Fix `Repository#getGitDirectoryPath()` for absent or loading repos (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1031)
- Collect an --exec-path from a native git installation, if any (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1057)
- Pass credentials correctly when username is provided in the git URL (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1065)
- Fix stale function reference when calling context menu handler (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1072)

name: 1.19.0-beta6
body:
* Upgrade text-buffer to fix spurious conflict and reload events #15121
* Fix gutter decoration regression #15135

name: 1.19.0-beta5
body:
- Fix exceptions when measuring pixel positions with pending content updates.
 [#15051](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15051)

name: 1.19.0-beta4
body:
* Swap underlying editor correctly when calling setModel on editor element (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15013).
* Check if incoming element is non-null before attempting to append to it (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15011).
* Fix regressions handling mousedown on Linux and macOS (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14987)

name: 1.19.0-beta3
body:
* Fixed a bug that prevented opening files with non-ascii characters in their names on windows (#14894).
* Restored a class that was accidentally removed from decoration elements (#14941).
* Restored attributes that were accidentally removed from line number elements (#14941).

name: 1.19.0-beta2
body:
* Fixed a crash on Windows when opening some files containing invalid UTF8 content (atom/superstring#16).
* Fixed an error when launching Atom on older Linux systems (atom/superstring#16).
* Fixed a bug where Atom's custom title bar would sometimes fail to update (#14897).
* Fixed rendering issues with the text editor's gutter when using certain packages (#14893).
* Fixed rendering issues with block decorations (#14895).

name: 1.19.0-beta1
body:
* Fixed a bug where removing trailing whitespace didn't work in files with CRLF line endings.
* Fixed a bug where the line ending selector's tooltip sometimes had the wrong text.

name: 1.19.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes

* Atom's underlying text buffer has been [implemented in native C++](https://github.com/atom/superstring)
* [Full rewrite](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13880) of the editor's rendering layer
* [Update to Electron 1.6.9](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696)
* [Render line number gutter without numbers when showLineNumbers is false](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14694)
* [Improved clarity of Editor not responding actions](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14753)
* [Restore ability for `escape` to return focus to center](https://github.com/atom/tree-view/pull/1127)
* [Optimize trailing whitespace removal using native buffer search](https://github.com/atom/whitespace/pull/157)

## Notable Changes

* All new [Git and GitHub Integration](https://github.atom.io)
* [Improved tokenizing performance via oniguruma caching](https://github.com/atom/first-mate/issues/93)
* [Correctly launch Atom from Windows Subsystem for Linux](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14287)
* [Added an option to always restore previous session](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13947)
* [Added settings for showing context in find-and-replace](https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/847)
* [Improved suggestions in autocomplete-html](https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-html/pulls?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Apr%20is%3Aclosed%20author%3A50wliu%20updated%3A%3C2017-05-04)

name: 1.18.0-beta3
body:
## Notable Changes

- Restore status bar's ability to display info for files in pending panes (e.g., when single-clicking files in the tree view). https://github.com/atom/status-bar/issues/194
- Open the staged and unstaged changes from the context menu when editing a file. atom/github#879
- Provide friendlier startup behavior for the GitHub package: add background tips, a Welcome section, and only activate the docks by default once. atom/github#875, atom/github#895, atom/welcome#62, atom/background-tips#30
- Show a warning instead of an error when a pull results in merge conflicts. atom/github#877

name: 1.18.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes

* All new [Git and GitHub Integration](https://github.atom.io)
* [Improved tokenizing performance via oniguruma caching](https://github.com/atom/first-mate/issues/93)
* [Correctly launch Atom from Windows Subsystem for Linux](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14287)
* [Added an option to always restore previous session](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13947)
* [Added settings for showing context in find-and-replace](https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/847)
* [Improved suggestions in autocomplete-html](https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-html/pulls?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Apr%20is%3Aclosed%20author%3A50wliu%20updated%3A%3C2017-05-04)

name: 1.17.0-beta5
body:
- Pinch and zoom is correctly disabled. [#14252](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/14252)
- `urlOpen` has been fixed. [#14320](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14320)
- The 'Search in Directory' context menu has been restored in find and replace. [#887](https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/887)
- Fuzzy finder correctly handles quick text entry again. [#288](https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/288)
- An uncaught exception from the incompatible package finder has been fixed. [#21](https://github.com/atom/incompatible-packages/issues/21)
- Empty space next to tree view items is clickable again. [#1075](https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/1075)

name: 1.17.0-beta4
body:
- Fixed bug where bundled packages were loaded instead of dev packages
- Updated to Electron 1.3.15 to address remote module issues https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/9240

name: 1.17.0-beta3
body:
* Fixed a bug that caused the tree-view to unexpectedly gain focus.
* Fixed a bug that prevented the tree-view from showing when adding a project folder.
* Fixed a bug that caused the tree-view to initially have the incorrect width.
* Fixed a bug where `cmd-w` would close the tree-view when it was focused.

name: 1.17.0-beta2
body:
* Fixed a regression that made it impossible to toggle closed docks. (#14203)
* Fixed a bug in `atom.worskpace.openSync` test helper. (#14205)

name: 1.17.0-beta1
body:
* Ensure `atom-text-editor` element is initialized before loading packages (#14194)
* Hide dock resize handles when docks are hidden (#14178)

## Notable Changes

* [More title-bar options](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13616) on macOS.
* [Restore the correct directory's project state](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13810) when opening a new file from the CLI.
* Lots of progress in our ongoing effort to remove jQuery from bundled packages.
* [Add the "dalek" package](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13525)  to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in `~/.atom/packages` that are overshadowing core packages.

<details>
<summary>All Changes</summary>

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

1.15.0...1.16.0

* [atom/atom#13806 - Overhaul element pool and debug double-free errors](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13806)
* [atom/atom#13808 - Fix code-signing on CircleCI](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13808)
* [atom/atom#13781 - Avoid emitting path change events while destroying the Project](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13781)
* [atom/atom#13817 - Throw exceptions when decorating destroyed marker layers](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13817)
* [atom/atom#13820 - Avoid hangs when opening minified files](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13820)
* [atom/atom#13810 - Restore correct directory's project state when opening a new file from the CLI](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13810)
* [atom/atom#13823 - Upgrade to Babel 6 and apply fewer transformations when transpiling babel files](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13823)
* [atom/atom#13818 - Return decorations for markers from *all* marker layers from decorationsForScreenRowRange](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13818)
* [atom/atom#13843 - Respect the --resource-path flag](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13843)
* [atom/atom#13754 - Normalize disk drive letter in path on Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13754)
* [atom/atom#13616 - More title-bar options (macOS)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13616)
* [atom/atom#13525 - Add dalek package to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in ~/.atom/packages](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13525)
* [atom/atom#13825 - Relativize spec paths more when reporting](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13825)
* [atom/atom#13875 - :bug: Fix apm shell script reference in Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13875)
* [atom/atom#13887 - Ignore `ref` and `key` props in `TextEditor.prototype.update`](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13887)
* [atom/atom#13898 - Use new maxLineLength parameter to GrammarRegistry](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13898)
* [atom/atom#13918 - Cause an assertion failure if defaultMarkerLayer is destroyed early](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13918)
* [atom/atom#13919 - Throw an error when assertions fail if built from source](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13919)
* [atom/atom#13842 - Updating requires for linux to support 32bit build(For Testing)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13842)
* [atom/atom#13912 - Remove macOS emoji workaround](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13912)
* [atom/atom#13922 - Convert workspace to JavaScript](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13922)
* [atom/atom#13929 - Fix destroying a `PanelContainer` containing multiple panels](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13929)

name: 1.17.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes

* Improved Atom's startup time through the use of V8 custom startup snapshots.
  * https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13916
* Extended Atom's workspace with new Dock system for organizing auxiliary tools.
  * https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13878
  * https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13977

<details>
<summary>All Changes</summary>

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.16.0-beta0...1.17.0-beta0

* [atom/atom#13916 - Startup Snapshot](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13916)
* [atom/atom#14021 - Use the generated snapshot source map in `source-map-support`](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14021)
* [atom/atom#14026 - Update CSS languages, autocomplete-css](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14026)
* [atom/atom#14024 - Snapshot `AtomEnvironment`](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14024)
* [atom/atom#14038 - Optimize style sheets loading](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14038)
* [atom/atom#14065 - Fix typo in comments of text-editor-registry.js](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14065)
* [atom/atom#13963 - Restore atom environment when adding project folders to a fresh window](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13963)
* [atom/atom#13764 - Disable soft wrap on mini editors](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13764)
* [atom/atom#14096 - Don't snapshot minimatch and fix package transpilation registry on win32](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14096)
* [atom/atom#13977 - Docks](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13977)
* [atom/atom#14103 - Add `atom.workspace.hide()`](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14103)
* [atom/atom#14027 - Add `saveFocusedPaneItem()` and call it in "core:save" command](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14027)
* [atom/atom#14104 - Fixes #14102 to use ATOM_HOME if present.](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14104)
* [atom/atom#14080 - Packages preloading](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14080)
* [atom/atom#14116 - Assign `Package.prototype.mainModulePath` eagerly for preloaded packages](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14116)
* [atom/atom#14107 - Always add opened items to the workspace](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14107)
* [atom/atom#14119 - Fix issue #14109 and #13978](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14119)
* [atom/atom#14108 - :bug: Fix observation of moved items](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14108)
* [atom/atom#14063 - fixing middle mouse button clipboard paste on linux (atom:atom#8648)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14063)
* [atom/atom#14135 - 📝 Minor edits to CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14135)
* [atom/atom#14134 - Don't store default locations](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14134)
* [atom/atom#14125 - Allow workspace item objects to be passed to Workspace.open](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14125)
* [atom/atom#14136 - Open docks when activating their panes, but not when adding items](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14136)
* [atom/atom#13965 - Allow specifying installation directory](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13965)
* [atom/atom#14131 - Update build to pre-compile packages with per-package transpilation configs](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14131)
* [atom/atom#13813 - Attempt fixing exception when trying to use portable electronUserData](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13813)
* [atom/atom#14143 - Refine Dock UX and API](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14143)
* [atom/atom#14161 - Fix a regression in hovered dock tracking](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14161)
* [atom/atom#14168 - Fix adding bundled packages to `ModuleCache` and increase test coverage](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14168)
* [atom/atom#14174 - Avoid errors deserializing 1.17 workspace state in prior Atom versions](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14174)
* [atom/atom#14166 - Ensure that atom-panel tags can be created via HTML](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14166)
* [atom/atom#14175 - Always focus active pane item when pane is activated](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14175)
* [atom/atom#14137 - Document pane item interface on Workspace](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14137)
* [atom/atom#14183 - Properly restore focus to center when hiding dock via toggle](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14183)
* [atom/atom#14188 - Always search a pane container w/ the given URI in workspace.open](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14188)

### [one-dark-ui](https://github.com/atom/one-dark-ui)

v1.9.2...v1.10.2

name: 1.16.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes

* [More title-bar options](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13616) on macOS.
* [Restore the correct directory's project state](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13810) when opening a new file from the CLI.
* Lots of progress in our ongoing effort to remove jQuery from bundled packages.
* [Upgrade the bundled Babel to Babel 6](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13823)  and apply fewer transformations when transpiling babel files because the bundled libv8 handles quite a few things natively now.
* [Add the "dalek" package](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13525)  to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in `~/.atom/packages` that are overshadowing core packages.

<details>
<summary>All Changes</summary>

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.15.0...v1.16.0-beta0

* [atom/atom#13810 - Restore correct directory's project state when opening a new file from the CLI](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13810)
* [atom/atom#13823 - Upgrade to Babel 6 and apply fewer transformations when transpiling babel files](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13823)
* [atom/atom#13818 - Return decorations for markers from *all* marker layers from decorationsForScreenRowRange](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13818)
* [atom/atom#13843 - Respect the --resource-path flag](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13843)
* [atom/atom#13754 - Normalize disk drive letter in path on Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13754)
* [atom/atom#13616 - More title-bar options (macOS)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13616)
* [atom/atom#13525 - Add dalek package to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in ~/.atom/packages](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13525)
* [atom/atom#13825 - Relativize spec paths more when reporting](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13825)
* [atom/atom#13875 - :bug: Fix apm shell script reference in Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13875)
* [atom/atom#13918 - Cause an assertion failure if defaultMarkerLayer is destroyed early](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13918)
* [atom/atom#13919 - Throw an error when assertions fail if built from source](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13919)
* [atom/atom#13842 - Updating requires for linux to support 32bit build(For Testing)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13842)
* [atom/atom#13912 - Remove macOS emoji workaround](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13912)

* [atom/atom#13945 - Always restore Reopen Project menu, fixes #13758](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13945)
* [atom/atom#13941 - Update languages](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13941)

## Notable Changes

* [Duplicate selections with multiple lines](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13602) now behaves in a more intuitive way.
* [Added a core option for closing deleted file tabs](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13657), while the default remains keeping these tabs open to prevent potentially losing data.
* [Show cursor by default on MacOS](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13664).
* [Disable periodic serialization for large buffers](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13583) to improve performance when editing large files.
* [Improvements to line tokenization](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13820) to improve editor performance when opening files with large, uninterrupted lines, like minified JavaScript. Opt out of this behavior from [certain grammars like language-gfm](https://github.com/atom/language-gfm/pull/187).
* [Remove projects correctly](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13685)  from the Windows jump list.
* [Node 6 is now required to _build_ Atom.](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13696)
* [Always reserve horizontal space for two digits on the line number gutter](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13585) to prevent UI jitter when transitioning from 9 lines to 10 lines.
* [Add a setting to apply the Chromium proxy configuration to apm via env vars](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13600).
* [Show the default value in a tooltip](https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/688) when one is present in the settings view.

name: 1.15.0-beta4
body:
- Highlight abstract and sealed class modifiers in C# language grammar. https://github.com/atom/language-csharp/commit/4984ad1b943caa85afea5be06df2341e6f4a5e38
- Fixed a regression that prevented `apm.sh` from running on Windows. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13875
- Fixed a performance regression that slowed down parsing JavaScript arrays. https://github.com/atom/language-javascript/pull/494
- Improved support for using `TextEditor` as an etch component. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13887

- Highlight abstract and sealed class modifiers in C# language grammar. https://github.com/atom/language-csharp/commit/4984ad1b943caa85afea5be06df2341e6f4a5e38
- Fixed a regression that prevented `apm.sh` from running on Windows. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13875
- Improved support for using `TextEditor` as an etch component. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13887

name: 1.15.0-beta3
body:
- Prevent application hangs when loading files with extremely long lines. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13820
- Multiple fixes for rare edge cases in the new `DisplayLayer` code that could lead to corrupted text display states.
  - https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/211
  - https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/212
  - https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/213
- Fix an uncaught exception in find and replace https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/860

- Multiple fixes for rare edge cases in the new `DisplayLayer` code that could lead to corrupted text display states.
  - https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/211
  - https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/212
  - https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/213
- Fix an uncaught exception in find and replace https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/860

name: 1.15.0-beta2
body:
- Atom core changes:
  - Throw an exception when attempting to decorate a destroyed marker layer. #13817
  - Fix an exception related to keyboard layouts on certain Linux distros. #13785
  - Fix an exception that would occur when closing an Atom window. #13781
  - Fix 'This element has already been freed!' exceptions. #13806
- TextBuffer changes:
  - Ensure that markers are marked as destroyed when their marker layers are cleared via the new `MarkerLayer.clear` API. [atom/text-buffer#203](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/203)
  - Fix a rare stack overflow when editing large files. [atom/text-buffer#204](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/204)
  - Fix an exception when calling `DisplayMarkerLayer.findMarkers` from a `DisplayMarker.onDidDestroy` callback. [atom/text-buffer#205](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/205)
  - Fix regressions in multi-line searches introduced as part of a search optimization.
    - [atom/text-buffer#206](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/206)
    - [atom/text-buffer#207](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/207)
  - Introduce some assertions to help us debug some very rare exceptions. [atom/text-buffer#208](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/208)

- Atom core changes:
  - Throw an exception when attempting to decorate a destroyed marker layer. #13817
  - Fix an exception related to keyboard layouts on certain Linux distros. #13785
  - Fix an exception that would occur when closing an Atom window. #13781
- TextBuffer changes:
  - Ensure that markers are marked as destroyed when their marker layers are cleared via the new `MarkerLayer.clear` API. [atom/text-buffer#203](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/203)
  - Fix a rare stack overflow when editing large files. [atom/text-buffer#204](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/204)
  - Fix an exception when calling `DisplayMarkerLayer.findMarkers` from a `DisplayMarker.onDidDestroy` callback. [atom/text-buffer#205](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/205)
  - Fix regressions in multi-line searches introduced as part of a search optimization.
    - [atom/text-buffer#206](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/206)
    - [atom/text-buffer#207](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/207)
  - Introduce some assertions to help us debug some very rare exceptions. [atom/text-buffer#208](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/208)

name: 1.15.0-beta1
body:
- Fixed an issue searching for multi-line regular expressions containing unescaped newlines:
  - https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/854
- Fixed uncaught exceptions related to destroying markers:
  - https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6899
  - https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/855
- Fixed an issue on Windows where it wanted to 'upgrade' to non-beta builds
  - Please note you will need to run an installer. The 1.15.0-beta0 auto-updater was broken.

- Fixed an issue searching for multi-line regular expressions containing unescaped newlines:
  - https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/854
- Fixed uncaught exceptions related to destroying markers:
  - https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6899
  - https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/855

name: 1.15.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes
- The behavior when duplicating lines when there are multiple selections is now more intuitive.
- Atom will now keep open the tab of any file, modified or not, when it's deleted outside the editor. You can turn off this behavior with a new core setting:
  ![Deleted File Tab Setting](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/553742/22088980/e1f25d3e-dd9c-11e6-81de-53846a511971.png)
- Cursors remain [visible by default](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13664) when there is a selection. The old behavior of hiding cursors with a selection can be restored via a config setting.
- `apm` now [honors system HTTP proxy settings](https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/898).
- Removals from the Jump List on Windows are [now handled correctly](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13685).
- [Node 6 is now required to _build_ Atom](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13696/files).

## Notable Changes
- A fundamental data structure in the editor has been implemented in native code to reduce memory and yield better performance for large files. More improvements to come.
- Atom 1.14 makes available a [64-bit installation](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13135) for Windows.
- Improvements to the MRU tabs UX:
  - An MRU-ordered list of the tabs to visit now appears during MRU traversal.
  - There is an option in the tabs package settings to make ctrl-tab and ctrl-shift-tab do MRU or simple left/right traversal.
  - Fixed a bug in keyup handling such that the MRU order doesn't appear to randomly change.
- [Overhaul of the bundled C# grammar](https://github.com/atom/language-csharp/pull/87)
- [Upgrade find-and-replace to use new marker layer API for fast clearing of markers](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13516)
- [Option for avoiding overlay movements](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11852)
- [Reduce the impact of leaking Editor, Selection, & Cursor objects](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13523)

name: 1.14.0-beta4
body:
- Various `markdown-preview` fixes:
  - Scrolling on `core:move-up` / `core:move-down`https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/464
  - Zooming https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/462
  - Fix broken syntax highlighting of code blocks https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/461
- Fix scrolling with `core:move-up` and `core:move-down` commands in `deprecation-cop`. https://github.com/atom/deprecation-cop/commit/4d3d32a4cc4a16c04ccd04038faaa0c87c337818
- Fix a possible crash in the native Patch implementation. https://github.com/atom/superstring/pull/10
- Remove unnecessary dependency in Linux rpm package. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13573

name: 1.14.0-beta3
body:
- Fixed a regression that disabled syntax highlighting when converting Markdown to HTML (https://github.com/atom/highlights/pull/49)
- Fixed a regression that caused editors to throw exceptions when performing certain kinds of selection (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13687)
- Fixed a regression that caused Find and Replace to throw an error after opening and then closing a search result (https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/844)
- Solved an issue that caused Atom to throw an exception when setting an invalid font family (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13668)
- Solved an issue that sometimes prevented Windows users from submitting deprecation reports (https://github.com/atom/deprecation-cop/pull/78)
- Solved a bug that caused the editor's font size to not be increased/decreased when holding <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> and moving the mouse wheel (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13667)
- Solved a bug in apm that prevented packages with native dependencies from being installed on Atom Beta (https://github.com/atom/apm/pull/673)

- Fixed a regression that disabled syntax highlighting when converting Markdown to HTML (https://github.com/atom/highlights/pull/49)
- Fixed a regression that caused editors to throw exceptions when performing certain kinds of selection (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13687)
- Solved an issue that caused Atom to throw an exception when setting an invalid font family (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13668)
- Solved a bug that caused the editor's font size to not be increased/decreased when holding <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> and moving the mouse wheel (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13667)

name: 1.14.0-beta2
body:
- Fix [exceptions when undoing line movements](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4619) caused by [a bug](https://github.com/atom/superstring/pull/8) in Atom's native `Patch` module.
- Ensure command paths on Windows are quoted when containing a '#' edfd7c4eb7a92293a41743130f207c8d6afcecbd
- Update APM to ensure paths on Windows are always quoted to handle spaces etc. https://github.com/atom/apm/issues/666

name: 1.14.0-beta1
body:
- Correct beta update URL for Windows so no longer wants to upgrade 1.14.0-beta0 to 1.13.0 #13607
- Improve updates panel in settings-view to prevent inconsistent state https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/890
- Fixed a memory leak in the text buffer's marker system

Note: Windows users will need to manually update to this release.

name: 1.14.0-beta0
body:
# Notable Changes

### Portable mode

Portable mode is now available on macOS and Linux as well as Windows. Finding an adjacent .atom folder for settings now also takes precedence over the ATOM_HOME environment variable.

### Test Suite

Atom's test suite now uses a lot less disk space and cleans up as it runs. It also now runs and passes on x64 Windows.

# All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.13.0...v1.14.0-beta0
- [atom/atom#13305 - Make core and render tests pass on Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13305)
- [atom/atom#13358 - Add initialize() hook to packages](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13358)
- [atom/atom#13365 - Specs: test reliability & auto temp clean-up](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13365)
- [atom/atom#13384 - Replace "osx" to "macOS"](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13384)
- [atom/atom#13372 - Activate packages immediately if hook had already been triggered](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13372)
- [atom/atom#13266 - Flush DOM before displaying context menu](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13266)
- [atom/atom#13397 - Revert "Flush DOM before displaying context menu"](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13397)
- [atom/atom#13152 - Add and improve core.*OnStart setting descriptions](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13152)
- [atom/atom#13353 - Upgrade to Electron 1.3.13](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13353)
- [atom/atom#13386 - Replace `libXScrnSaver` with `libXss.so.1` in RPM package spec](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13386)

# Notable Changes

### Reopen Project

Want to get back to that combination of folders you had with the state as you left it?  Check out [Reopen Project](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13046) in the File menu!

### Performance

We now have a [benchmarking tool suite](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12984) to help us quantify and help address performance issues.

body: Reverted a "fix" for dependency installations on CentOS that actually made the problem worse. 🙀

name: 1.13.0-beta9
body:
- RPM dependency fix for CentOS #13421
- Use package-specific transpilation options during tests #13460

name: 1.13.0-beta8
body: Fixed a regression in 1.13 where an editor pane did not properly get focus when another pane was destroyed. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13206

name: 1.13.0-beta7
body:
- Upgrade to Electron 1.3.13 which includes several bug fixes including a [keybinding fix for Linux users](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13170).
- Replace `libXScrnSaver` with `libXss.so.1` in RPM package spec, resolving https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13354.
- [Activate packages immediately if hook had already been triggered](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13372).

- Upgrade to Electron 1.3.13 which includes several bug fixes including a [keybinding fix for Linux users](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13170).
- Replace `libXScrnSaver` with `libXss.so.1` in RPM package spec, resolving https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13354.
- [Activate packages immediately if hook had already been triggered](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13372).

name: 1.13.0-beta6
body:
- Fixed a bug in Find and Replace that made Atom throw an exception when writing invalid regular expressions. https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/817
- Added support for using SVG elements in block decorations. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13321
- Fixed a regression that was preventing Atom from being executed via the command line with the `--profile-startup` argument. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13288
- On Windows, fixed an issue that was causing Atom to not use the system keyboard language when changing it while Atom was open. https://github.com/atom/keyboard-layout/pull/22
- On Windows, solved a problem that was preventing certain keyboard languages (e.g. Saudi Arabian) from being recognized. https://github.com/atom/keyboard-layout/pull/23
- On Linux, fixed a regression that made Atom use 100% of a CPU core when launching it from a desktop shortcut or via the GNOME launcher. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13320
- On Linux, added a missing dependency to the RPM package that was preventing Atom from being opened when such dependency was not already installed on the system. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13289

- Added support for using SVG elements in block decorations. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13321
- Fixed a regression that was preventing Atom from being executed via the command line with the `--profile-startup` argument. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13288
- On Windows, fixed an issue that was causing Atom to not use the system keyboard language when changing it while Atom was open. https://github.com/atom/keyboard-layout/pull/22
- On Windows, solved a problem that was preventing certain keyboard languages (e.g. Saudi Arabian) from being recognized. https://github.com/atom/keyboard-layout/pull/23
- On Linux, fixed a regression that made Atom use 100% of a CPU core when launching it from a desktop shortcut or via the GNOME launcher. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13320
- On Linux, added a missing dependency to the RPM package that was preventing Atom from being opened when such dependency was not already installed on the system. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13289

name: 1.13.0-beta5
body:
- For non-Latin keyboards such as Russian and Hebrew, keystrokes containing modifiers are now resolved with U.S. layout characters for _all_ keys, not just keys with non-Latin keycaps. For example, `ctrl-.` and `ctrl-/` are now typed based on the position of those symbols on a U.S. layout. https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/179
- On Windows, dead keys now resolve to `dead` for binding purposes instead of their corresponding character. This is because looking up the unicode character for a dead key via Windows APIs interferes with the keyboard buffer, causing dead keys not to register for any keystroke in which such a lookup is performed. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13263
- Reverted a keymap behavior change in which keystrokes targeting a different DOM element were retargeted to the current focused element because it was causing an infinite recursion in certain edge cases. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13181
- Fixed an issue that was preventing syntax highlighting on HTML files from working correctly when an attribute contained ampersands. https://github.com/atom/language-html/issues/141
- On Windows and Linux, the shortcut for reloading Atom now works again and it has been changed to `ctrl-shift-f5` to avoid conflicts with the symbols-view package. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13267

- For non-Latin keyboards such as Russian and Hebrew, keystrokes containing modifiers are now resolved with U.S. layout characters for _all_ keys, not just keys with non-Latin keycaps. For example, `ctrl-.` and `ctrl-/` are now typed based on the position of those symbols on a U.S. layout. https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/179
- On Windows, dead keys now resolve to `dead` for binding purposes instead of their corresponding character. This is because looking up the unicode character for a dead key via Windows APIs interferes with the keyboard buffer, causing dead keys not to register for any keystroke in which such a lookup is performed. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13263
- Reverted a keymap behavior change in which keystrokes targeting a different DOM element were retargeted to the current focused element because it was causing an infinite recursion in certain edge cases. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13181
- Fixed an issue that was preventing syntax highlighting on HTML files from working correctly when an attribute contained ampersands. https://github.com/atom/language-html/issues/141

name: 1.13.0-beta4
body:
- Various default keybindings that used `ctrl-alt` and a letter have been rebound or removed on Windows and Linux to avoid conflicting with common international glyphs. Full details are below in **Default keymap changes**
- Fixed multiple key bindings issues caused by changes to improve international keyboard support:
  - Allow `ctrl-alt-` bindings to shadow the ability to type non-ASCII `AltGraph` characters on Windows international keyboards. If you need access to non-ASCII symbols that are shadowed by default key bindings you will need to `unset!` those bindings.
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/175
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/174
  - Fixed keystroke resolution on Windows when caps-lock is enabled.
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/182
  - Fixed key bindings interfering with IME text input
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/172
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/177
- Fixed path resolution issues with network-mapped paths by upgrading Electron to fix a bug in Node
  - https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13104

## Default keymap changes (Windows & Linux only)

To avoid conflicts with glyphs on international keyboards the following default keyboard shortcuts have been changed:
- `window:reload` is now <kbd>ctrl</kbd><kbd>shift</kbd><kbd>r</kbd>
- `window:run-package-specs` is now <kbd>ctrl</kbd><kbd>shift</kbd><kbd>y</kbd>
- `application:add-project-folder` is now <kbd>ctrl</kbd><kbd>shift</kbd><kbd>a</kbd>
- `editor:fold-selection` is now <kbd>ctrl</kbd><kbd>alt</kbd><kbd>shift</kbd><kbd>[</kbd>
- `autoflow:reflow-selection` is now <kbd>ctrl</kbd><kbd>shift</kbd><kbd>q</kbd>

We have also had to remove two that collide where no reasonable alternative mapping could be found. They are provided here in cson format so that if you want to re-enable them you can paste them into your own keymap.cson file:

``` cson
'atom-workspace atom-text-editor:not([mini])':
  'ctrl-alt-z': 'editor:checkout-head-revision'

'atom-workspace atom-text-editor':
  'ctrl-alt-shift-p': 'editor:log-cursor-scope'
```

macOS users are unaffected as they do not use <kbd>ctrl</kbd><kbd>alt</kbd> as a way to generate international symbols.

Please see the [customizing keybindings](http://flight-manual.atom.io/using-atom/sections/basic-customization/#customizing-keybindings) section of the Atom Flight Manual if you want to further reconfigure the default keymappings.

- Fixed multiple key bindings issues caused by changes to improve international keyboard support:
  - Allow `ctrl-alt-` bindings to shadow the ability to type non-ASCII `AltGraph` characters on Windows international keyboards. If you need access to non-ASCII symbols that are shadowed by default key bindings you will need to `unset!` those bindings. We'll be removing several default `ctrl-alt-` bindings in 1.13 so the potential for collision will be lower in the future.
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/175
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/174
  - Fixed keystroke resolution on Windows when caps-lock is enabled.
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/182
  - Fixed key bindings interfering with IME text input
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/172
    - https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/177
- Fixed path resolution issues with network-mapped paths by upgrading Electron to fix a bug in Node
  - https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13104

body:

name: 1.13.0-beta1
body:

- Fixed non-printable characters being inserted into the buffer when replaying certain keystroke sequences. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13172
- Removed two relatively obscure default key bindings that shadowed the ability to type ASCII characters on certain keyboard layouts.

- Fixed uncaught exception occurring when using input modes or input methods on macOS. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13154
- Fixed non-printable characters being inserted into the buffer when replaying certain keystroke sequences. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13172
- Removed two relatively obscure default key bindings that shadowed the ability to type ASCII characters on certain keyboard layouts.

name: 1.13.0-beta0
body:
# Notable changes
- Made large files open more quickly (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12898).
- Stopped using the shadow DOM in `atom-text-editor` elements (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12903).
- Sign and timestamp Windows binaries with SHA256 for help avoid false screening in anti-virus software.
- Reopen Project menu to access recently opened folders using the new atom.history api (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13046).

# Notable Changes

### International Keyboard Support

New APIs available in Chrome 52 allowed us to take on this [long-requested feature](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/35). The new APIs turned out to be less important than we originally thought but we're nonetheless happy to report Atom users in all locales now get typical keyboard behavior in Atom's default installation.

### Electron 1.3

Thanks to some amazing work by community maintainer [@thomasjo](https://github.com/thomasjo), Atom comes out of the Electron dark ages in this release with an update to 1.3.6, bringing Chrome 52 along for the ride.

### Keybinding Usability

The scope specificity rules for keybindings were understandably confusing lots of Atom users. This release has a [major simplification](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12760) such that user-defined keybindings take precedence.

### Windows Fixes

There are a number of tweaks specific to Atom on Windows, including:
- [Shell Integration upgrade reliability](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12642)
- [Allow multiple instances on Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9459)
- [Move emacs editor bindings to Darwin to avoid Windows menu conflicts](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12892)

As ever, you can find all the gory details in the full [release notes](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/tag/v1.12.0-beta0).

name: 1.12.0-beta7
body: - Fix resolution of keystrokes involving the `\` key on non-Latin keyboards.

name: 1.12.0-beta6
body:
- :arrow_up: tabs now account for dropping in another pane container https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/382
- :arrow_up: atom-keymap now has a public custom keystroke resolver api https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/pull/164
- :arrow_up: metrics now include processor architecture (32-bit/64-bit)
- Windows binaries are now timestamped and signed using sha256

name: 1.12.0-beta5
body:
- Remove `--harmony` flag to work around Chrome 53 bug. [#13073](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13073)
- :arrow_up: atom-keymap, fixing several keyboard layout bugs: [#161](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/pull/161), [#163](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/pull/163), [9b868](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/commit/9b868314fd0b9317d47387ab42ad5ceba6a741fd)

name: 1.12.0-beta4
body:
- Fix incorrect keystroke resolution on Linux when ctrl is held down on non-U.S. keyboard layouts. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12951
- Fix uncaught exception reading non-standard keyboard layouts on macOS. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13043

name: 1.12.0-beta3
body:
- Fixed a regression where `delete` on the numeric keypad was not recognized on Linux. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12958
- Fixed flickering of overlay decorations that could occur with split panes. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8295

- Fixed an error that would occur when opening a text editor using certain packages (https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12963)
- Fixed an error that would sometimes occur when installing packages in the settings-view (https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/850)
- Windows portable ZIP file now contains signed executables

name: 1.12.0-beta2
body:
More key binding bug fixes:
- Don't resolve `ctrl-backspace` to `ctrl-delete` when `NumLock` is enabled on Windows.

name: 1.12.0-beta1
body:
- Key binding bug fixes:
  - Fix interpretation of keystrokes involving the spacebar. Map to `space` keystroke string again instead of a literal space character. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12953
  - Substitute U.S. layout equivalents for non-Latin characters in all cases, not just when combined with modifier keys. Fixes vim-style bindings on non-Latin keyboards.

Notable Changes
- Fixed an exception that occurred when using the `auto-detect-indentation` package (https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12575).

name: 1.12.0-beta0
body:
## Notable Changes

### International Keyboard Support

New APIs available in Chrome 52 allowed us to take on this [long-requested feature](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/35). The new APIs turned out to be less important than we originally thought but we're nonetheless happy to report Atom users in all locales now get typical keyboard behavior in Atom's default installation.

### Electron 1.3

Thanks to some amazing work by community maintainer [@thomasjo](https://github.com/thomasjo), Atom comes out of the Electron dark ages in this release with an update to 1.3.6, bringing Chrome 52 along for the ride.

### Keybinding Usability

The scope specificity rules for keybindings were understandably confusing lots of Atom users. This release has a [major simplification](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12760) such that user-defined keybindings take precedence.

### Windows Fixes

There are a number of tweaks specific to Atom on Windows, including:
- [Shell Integration upgrade reliability](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12642)
- [Allow multiple instances on Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9459)
- [Move emacs editor bindings to Darwin to avoid Windows menu conflicts](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12892)

As ever, you can find all the gory details in the full [release notes](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/tag/v1.12.0-beta0).

Get all these improvements today by joining the [Atom Beta Channel](https://atom.io/beta)!

## All Changes

## Notable Changes

### Telemetry Permission

On launching 1.11 for the first time, all users will be presented with this screen asking for their assistance in improving Atom by allowing us to collect information while they use the application:

![Telemetry Permission View](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/118951/18135210/f71cb304-6f55-11e6-8714-efba045f1a9f.png)

This is something that a lot of users have been asking for. We've always had ways to opt out but it is only right to make it obvious and clear. Now it is!

### Improvements and Bug Fixes
- Added a configuration option for the large file warning threshold
- Three improvements to the [image-view package](https://atom.io/packages/image-view) by first time code contributor [@Ben3eeE](https://github.com/ben3eee) :tada:
  - Image View tabs that are in the pending state can now be confirmed by double-clicking the tabs
  - The status bar now shows the size in bytes of the image as well as the width and height
  - Fixed a bug where the dimensions of an image were reported as zero if more than one image was opened in the same action
- An option to show a [custom title bar](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11790) on macOS got added by [@brumm](https://github.com/brumm) :sparkles:
- Fixed a regression in the environment patching on macOS for users of the zsh shell
- Made the Split Pane menu items work the way they used to

name: 1.11.0-beta3
body:
## 🚨 Mac Users Please Note 🚨

This beta changes the name of the application executable inside the package from `Atom` to `Atom Beta`. This causes a problem on first-time launch because of macOS' application package caching. The easiest way to fix it is:
1. Open a terminal window
2. Execute `mv /Applications/Atom\ Beta.app ~/Desktop`
3. Execute `mv ~/Desktop/Atom\ Beta.app /Applications`
4. Exit the terminal window and start Atom Beta normally

☝️ This forces macOS to refresh its cache and things will work properly from there. This will only ever need to be done once on the first install of 1.11.0-betaX. After that, things will be fine.

## Notable Changes
- Fixed a regression where Atom couldn't start on Ubuntu 12.04 machines with an outdated version of libstdc++. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12589

name: 1.11.0-beta0
body:
## 🚨 Mac Users Please Note 🚨

This beta changes the name of the application executable inside the package from `Atom` to `Atom Beta`. This causes a problem on first-time launch because of macOS' application package caching. The easiest way to fix it is:
1. Open a terminal window
2. Execute `mv /Applications/Atom\ Beta.app ~/Desktop`
3. Execute `mv ~/Desktop/Atom\ Beta.app /Applications`
4. Exit the terminal window and start Atom Beta normally

☝️ This forces macOS to refresh its cache and things will work properly from there. This will only ever need to be done once on the first install of 1.11.0-betaX. After that, things will be fine.

## Notable Changes

### Telemetry Permission

On launching 1.11 for the first time, all users will be presented with this screen asking for their assistance in improving Atom by allowing us to collect information while they use the application:

![Telemetry Permission View](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/118951/18135210/f71cb304-6f55-11e6-8714-efba045f1a9f.png)

This is something that a lot of users have been asking for. We've always had ways to opt out but it is only right to make it obvious and clear. Now it is!

### Improvements and Bug Fixes
- Added a configuration option for the large file warning threshold
- Three improvements to the [image-view package](https://atom.io/packages/image-view) by first time code contributor [@Ben3eeE](https://github.com/ben3eee) :tada:
  - Image View tabs that are in the pending state can now be confirmed by double-clicking the tabs
  - The status bar now shows the size in bytes of the image as well as the width and height
  - Fixed a bug where the dimensions of an image were reported as zero if more than one image was opened in the same action
- An option to show a [custom title bar](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11790) on macOS got added by [@brumm](https://github.com/brumm) :sparkles:
- Fixed a regression in the environment patching on macOS for users of the zsh shell
- Made the Split Pane menu items work the way they used to

## Notable Changes

### Atom Package Manager Upgrade

The new version of apm runs on Node 4.4.5 and npm 3.10.5. This has a number of benefits including:
- Package dependencies are now flattened by npm 3, reducing problems with paths exceeding the path length restriction on Windows
- Package that depend on native modules now install more reliably
- Installing packages from behind proxy servers should work more easily now

### Windows

People on Windows have asked for more control over shell integrations. So we added a System panel to the Settings View on Windows for more control over Atom's integration with the operating system. Check it out :grinning:

### New UI inputs

A few commonly used inputs and other controls got added. Open the [Style Guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/creating-a-theme/#atom-styleguide) in Atom to see how you can use them in your package or further style in your theme.

![atom-ui-inputs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/18082549/6d9d83cc-6eda-11e6-8180-70eae5b6e78e.png)

name: 1.10.0-beta7
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fixed an error where background tasks did not run properly on windows.

### Notable Changes
- Fix a rare exception thrown when saving backup files without sufficient permissions.
- Add the `autoWidth` property to `TextEditor`. If you pass this property on construction, the editor's width will be based on its content. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12448

name: 1.10.0-beta6
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fix a rare exception thrown when saving backup files without sufficient permissions.
- Add the `autoWidth` property to `TextEditor`. If you pass this property on construction, the editor's width will be based on its content. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12448

### Notable Changes
- Fix an issue where `grammar-used` activation hooks were not triggered properly on startup.
- Fix an error that would occur when reloading a window with no project folders.
- Fix a couple uncaught exceptions introduced via the new pane-split-via-tab-dragging UX: https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/332 and https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/354.
- Fix a rare uncaught exception that could occur in display layers: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12085
- Fix an uncaught exception from the settings view when package update fails: https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/766

name: 1.10.0-beta5
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fix an issue where `grammar-used` activation hooks were not triggered properly on startup.
- Fix an error that would occur when reloading a window with no project folders.
- Fix a couple uncaught exceptions introduced via the new pane-split-via-tab-dragging UX: https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/332 and https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/354.
- Fix a rare uncaught exception that could occur in display layers: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12085
- Fix an uncaught exception from the settings view when package update fails: https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/766

name: 1.10.0-beta4
body:
### Notable Changes
- Send additional metadata to Bugsnag to investigate a rare uncaught exception in the display layer.
- Don't delete metadata of bundled packages even though it is cached.

### Notable Changes
- Send additional metadata to Bugsnag to investigate a rare uncaught exception in the display layer.
- Don't delete metadata of bundled packages even though it is cached.

name: 1.10.0-beta3
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fix an issue where Atom would lose track of Git statuses after changing window focus with multiple project paths. https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/906
- Fix an issue where overlay items were incorrectly positioned after resizing the window thanks to contributor @ypresto. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8295
- Fix an uncaught exception that resulted from an edge case involving the whitespace, auto-save, and status-bar packages.

### Notable Changes
- Fix an issue where Atom would lose track of Git statuses after changing window focus with multiple project paths. https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/906
- Fix an issue where overlay items were incorrectly positioned after resizing the window thanks to contributor @ypresto. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8295
- Fix an uncaught exception that resulted from an edge case involving the whitespace, auto-save, and status-bar packages.

### Notable Changes
- Fix a problem that was preventing exceptions from being reported to Bugsnag.

### Notable Changes
- Fix [an error](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12328) that would occur when opening a directory using the 'Open Folder' dialog.

name: 1.10.0-beta2
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fix an issue that would cause fuzzy-finder's background indexing process to fail after opening a path from the terminal that was already open in a window: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12317
- Fix an [uncaught exception](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12111) associated with decorating the same buffer marker in multiple editors.

### Notable Changes
- Fix an issue that would cause fuzzy-finder's background indexing process to fail after opening a path from the terminal that was already open in a window: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12317
- Fix an [uncaught exception](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12111) associated with decorating the same buffer marker in multiple editors.

### Notable Changes
- Fix a bug that prevented text from soft-wrapping properly
- Fix a bug that caused the editor.softWrapHangingIndent setting to be ignored

### Notable Changes
- Fix uncaught exceptions when folding in certain situations with certain grammars, such as Python.

name: 1.10.0-beta1
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fix uncaught exceptions when folding in certain situations with certain grammars, such as Python.
- Fix an uncaught exception when a package's native dependencies are compiled against the wrong version of V8.
- Fix a bug that caused the `editor.softWrapHangingIndent` setting to be ignored.
- Fix a regression that prevented Atom from starting when `~/.atom` was missing.

name: 1.10.0-beta0
body:
### Notable Changes
- Upgrade `apm`'s embedded Node to 4.4.5, resolving issues installing packages with native dependencies.
- Add a system panel to the settings view on Windows for integration with operating system.
- Allow package tests to be stored in a `test` directory instead of `spec`.

### Notable Changes
- Internal rendering redesign: Display Layers
- Electron upgraded to v0.37.8
- Drag and Drop layout management
- Remove non-public `GitRepositoryAsync` API to address issues with instability. We'll reintroduce a more stable async Git API in the future.
- Cygwin and Msys compatibility on Windows
- Better file recovery mechanism

name: 1.9.0-beta2
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fixed an issue where pressing spacebar in an editor would scroll the containing view.

name: 1.9.0-beta1
body:
### Notable Changes
- Avoid crashes by temporarily removing support for async git interactions.

name: 1.9.0-beta0
body:
### Notable Changes
- Internal rendering redesign: Display Layers
- Electron upgraded to v0.37.8
- Drag and Drop layout management
- Cygwin and Msys compatibility on Windows
- Better file recovery mechanism

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

name: 1.8.0-beta0
body:
### Notable Changes
- New commands for moving text left and right by one column. They are bound to cmd-ctrl-left and cmd-ctrl-right on OS X and alt-shift-left and alt-shift-right on Windows and Linux.
- Added the ability to update an Atom window's environment from the terminal by executing the same command with an updated terminal environment.

### Notable Changes
- Most recently used tab switching 
- Atom now supports the --add swich (aliased to -a) which will add the passed directory as a project folder to the most recently focused Atom window instead of opening that folder in its own window.
- Atom's Keymap file now supports a new syntax for dispatching events on keyup events
- Atom periodically saves editor state for crash recovery
- Packages using Async Git
- Electron Update
- Windows Improvements

name: 1.7.0-beta5
body:
- Fix opening of fuzzy-finder items in split panes via default bindings. See [atom/fuzzy-finder#189](https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/pull/189).
- Fix an issue with the pending state of items being terminated before such items were replaced. See [atom/atom#11352](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11352).

### Notable Changes
- Fix [atom/atom#11203 – Hitting an unbound key sequence sharing a prefix with a bound sequence freezes atom](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11203) via atom/atom-keymap#124.

name: 1.7.0-beta4
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fix [atom/atom#11203 – Hitting an unbound key sequence sharing a prefix with a bound sequence freezes atom](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11203) via atom/atom-keymap#124.

name: 1.7.0-beta3
body: - Fix issue #11234 (`Uncaught TypeError: patch.getChanges is not a function`) via [atom/text-buffer#147](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/147).

name: 1.7.0-beta2
body:
- [atom/apm#532 - Fix package installation when package exports bins](https://github.com/atom/apm/pull/532)
- [atom/text-buffer@5335d0f - Use fat arrow in `groupChangesSinceChekpoint()` assertion](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/commit/5335d0f4f2a4c8e690ace70be728336da25551c8)

name: 1.7.0-beta1
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fix an issue where environments from previous versions of Atom were not being restored.
- Reduce disk I/O for Git repository interaction.
- Prevent an [exception from being thrown](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11234) and add an assertion to help us track down the root cause.

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.7.0-beta0...1.7-releases
- [atom/atom#11251 - Fallback to ~/.atom/storage when no state is found in IndexedDb](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11251)
- [atom/atom#11277 - Less disk IO](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11277)
- [atom/atom#11295 - Take the submodule into account in more instances.](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11295)

### [settings-view](https://github.com/atom/settings-view)

v0.235.0...v0.235.1
- [atom/settings-view#752 - Improve installing Git-based packages](https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/752)

### Notable Changes
- Ensure `atom.cmd --wait` correctly waits in Windows cmd & powershell
- Reduce disk I/O interacting with Git to improve experience on network drives:
  - [atom/atom#11277 - Less disk IO](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11277)
  - [atom/atom#11295 - Take the submodule into account in more instances.](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11295)

### Notable changes
- Add functionality and API for pending pane items
- Improvements to multi-pane usage
- [Block Decorations](http://blog.atom.io/2016/02/03/introducing-block-decorations.html)
- Async Git
- Top and bottom bar API

name: 1.7.0-beta0
body:
### Notable Changes
- Periodically save editor's state for crash recovery
- Most recently used tab switching
- Several improvements to Windows experience
- On OS X, when you launch Atom from the Dock, Spotlight or Finder, it receives a different startup environment than when you launch Atom from the terminal
- Electron update to 0.36 series

name: 1.6.0-beta8
body:
### Notable Changes
- Don't destroy pane if replacing last pending item (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11009).
- Move Pane::addItem 'pending' option to options object (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11057).
- Fixed tab activation not being correct when replacing pending tabs (https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/278).
- Fixed issues in git-diff when the file contains unicode characters (https://github.com/atom/git-diff/issues/88, https://github.com/atom/git-diff/issues/89).
- Fixed status bar not updating the current branch (https://github.com/atom/status-bar/issues/128).

### Notable Changes
- Fixed an issue that caused vim-mode's scrolling commands to work incorrectly with soft-wrapped lines

name: 1.6.0-beta7
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fixed an issue that caused vim-mode's scrolling commands to work incorrectly with soft-wrapped lines.
- Preview tabs now work correctly for non-text files like images and archives.
- Fixed an issue on Windows where files with CRLF line endings couldn't be saved if they had changes (https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10931).

name: 1.6.0-beta6
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fixed a potential crash when viewing a changed file on Windows (https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10965).

name: 1.6.0-beta5

### Notable Changes
- Fix gutter highlights on files with capital letters in the name
- Ensure pending files/tabs are made permanent when opened from fuzzy-finder

name: 1.6.0-beta0
body:
### Notable Changes
- Block Decorations
- Multi-pane API improvements
- Top/Bottom bars API
- Pending tabs improvements
- Pending tabs API
- `atom --wait` works on Windows
- Nodegit built in / Async Git Repository class https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/9213
- Fixes issues when open project uses submodules
- Built windows versions of PRs can no be downloaded from AppVeyor
- Several improvements to language-js
- Add the ability to move files via drag drop from the OS into the tree-view

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

name: 1.5.0-beta1
body:
### Notable Changes
- Fixed an error that prevented Atom from starting correctly.
- Fixed an exception that would occur when undoing or redoing with a file open in multiple panes.

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

- [atom/text-buffer#123 - Fix exception when snapshot references non-existent marker layers](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/123)

### Notable Changes
- Fixed an error that prevented Atom from starting correctly.
- Fixed an exception that would occur when undoing or redoing with a file open in multiple panes.

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.4.0...v1.4.1

v8.1.2...v8.1.4

- [atom/text-buffer#123 - Fix exception when snapshot references non-existent marker layers](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/123)

### Notable Changes
- Untitled documents in a project are now serialized and restored.
- Use unique text editor title in window and tab titles.
