- Fixed an issue causing an error to be logged when pasting in the tree view when nothing was previously copied.
- Git support now works properly for projects with a `.git` file instead of a `.git` folder.

### Major Changes
- The keymap now waits for a timeout when a keystroke sequence exactly matches one key binding and partially matches others.
- You can now apply editor styles that change the line height and character width without messing up cursor positioning and softwrap calculations.
- Atom now uses the integrated GPU rather than the discrete GPU, improving battery life.
- `apm search` now supports a `--packages` and `--themes` option to return only those results.
- The whitespace after the cursor is now preserved when entering a newline with auto-indenting enabled.

### Major Changes
- Fixed a bug causing the active editor to change when dragging a selection over a tab.
- Fixed a bug causing find and replace to throw errors when searching for text contained in an untitled buffer.
- Fixed a bug causing `atom -h` and  `atom -v` to print out warnings from Chromium.

### Major Changes
- The fuzzy finder (cmd-t) now has the previously active editor at the top of the list when opened
- The `atom` command now supports opening paths that contains spaces
- The symbols view (cmd-r) now shows symbols based on the selected grammar instead of file extension
- Tokenization is now faster for lines that do not contain any multi-byte characters
- The `pane:close` event now properly closes the pane when triggered
- Packages with empty activation events are now activated immediately
- The autosave package will only save when the file is modified
- The tree view has duplicate and copy/cut/paste commands
- The `atom` cli command doesn't assume the Atom.app is in `/Applications`
- Fixed occasional exceptions duplicating lines.

### Major Changes
- The tree view can now be shown on the right side using the `tree-view.showOnRightSide` config setting
- Fixed an issue with tabs not being draggable

### Major Changes
- The `editor:duplicate-line` command has been renamed to `editor:duplicate-lines`. It can now handle multiple multi-line selections.
- The `persistent: false` option is now honored for markers.
- [Content Security Policy](http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/security/content-security-policy/) has been enabled in Atom to prevent accidentally running inline scripts in rendered content.
- Tabs now correctly focus the editor when clicked.

### Major Changes
- Hyperlinks and TODO/FIXME blocks now properly highlight in untitled editors

### Major Changes
- The markdown preview can now be toggled for untitled editors
- The markdown preview now updates as you type, no more saving required
- The bracket matcher package now properly indents when hitting enter when your cursor is between `{}`, `[]`, etc.
- PHP snippets are now working

### Major Changes
- Soft-wrapped lines are no longer hidden by the scrollbar.
- Fixed buggy behavior when soft-wrapped lines contained hard tab characters.

### API Changes
- The path returned from `atom.packages.getApmPath()` must now be spawned using a `BufferedProcess` instead of a `BufferedNodeProcess`.

### Major Changes
- The `autocomplete:attach` has been renamed to `autocomplete:toggle` to be more accurate and consistent with other package events
- The fuzzy finder now supports ignoring extensions such as `*.class`
- The tree view now supports hiding extensions such as `*.class`

### Major Changes
- The Go language is now supported in the Symbols view (`cmd-r`)
- `apm` now comes bundled with node preventing version inconsistencies with the locally installed node
- Restored broken links in the guide building a package.

### Major Changes
- The `fuzzyFinder.ignoredNames` config setting has been renamed to `fuzzy-finder.ignoredNames` so that the config namespace matches the package name. Existing settings should be updated to use the new name

### Bug Fixes
- Fixed occasional errors when editing with folded lines.
- Fixed occasional lockups when switching tabs with certain themes.
- Fixed a bug where you couldn't open multiple unsaved buffers.

### Major Changes
- :bug: The version of `npm` bundled with `apm` has been upgraded to fix a `SELF_SIGNED_CERT_IN_CHAIN` error when installing packages that have dependencies that are published to npmjs.org

name: Promethium
body:
### Major Changes
- `apm login` now supports sending 2FA codes over SMS
- Whitespace is now ignored in fuzzy filtered queries such as `cmd-t` and `cmd-shift-p`
- :bug: Fixed an issue with find and replace failing when there was an untitled dirty buffer

name: Neodymium
body:
### Major changes
- :bug: Fixed a bug when viewing a disabled package in the Settings view
- :bug: Fixed a bug when running `apm update` and `apm init` with missing arguments

name: Praseodymium
body:
This is the first release of the Atom beta, thanks for trying it out! :tada: 

In future releases you will see important information here about bug fixes, new features, and API changes.

name: Cerium
body:
This is the first release of the Atom beta, thanks for trying it out! :tada: 

In future releases you will see important information here about bug fixes, new features, and API changes.

name: Lanthanum
body:
This is the first release of the Atom beta, thanks for trying it out! :tada: 

In future releases you will see important information here about bug fixes, new features, and API changes.

name: Barium
body:
This is the first release of the Atom beta, thanks for trying it out! :tada: 

In future releases you will see important information here about bug fixes, new features, and API changes.

name: Caesium
body: ### No Major Changes

name: Xenon
body: ### No Major Changes

name: Iodine
body: ### No Major Changes

name: Tellurium
body:
### Major Changes
- :chart_with_upwards_trend::watch: The symbols view can now load large `tags` files (100k+ tags)

### API Changes
- `fs` and `_` are no longer available from `require 'atom'`. You should depend on these explicitly via a dependency in your package's `package.json` file

name: Antimony
body:
### For Users
- :gift::bug: Several soft wrapping bugs have been fixed
- :lock_with_ink_pen::computer: Atom now prompts for a password when saving files that require admin privileges

### For Developers
- The `File` and `Directory` classes previously available from `require 'atom'` are now available from the [pathwatcher](https://github.com/atom/node-pathwatcher) module via `{File, Directory} = require 'pathwatcher'`

name: Tin
body:
### For Users
- :lock_with_ink_pen::bug: Fixed an issue with spell check corrections not working properly
- :left_right_arrow::computer: Use `cmd-k cmd-up/down/left/right` to change focus between panes
- :pencil2::wave: The init script has been remamed to `~/.atom/init.coffee`, you should rename your `~/.atom/user.coffee` file after updating
- :new::mag: `cmd-0` now resets Atom to use its default editor font size

### For Developers
- The `atom.pasteboard` global has been renamed to `atom.clipboard`
-  Theme's `package.json` files should how contain a `theme` key with either a value of `"syntax"` or `"ui"`.  This affects how the Atom settings view groups with either the syntax or UI themes
- The `sync` and `immediate` options to `atom.packages.activatePackage` have been removed.  `atom.packages.activatePackage` now returns a promise..
- [Squirrel](https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Mac) is now used as the auto updater, previously [Sparkle](https://github.com/andymatuschak/Sparkle) was used

name: Indium
body:
### For Users
- :necktie::tada: GitHub Enterprise repos are now supported when running GitHub commands such as opening history and blaming
- :rainbow::wrench: Redesigned and improved settings view
- :recycle::eyes:  Changes to `~/.atom/snippets.cson` automatically reload, no more refreshing required
- :pencil2::wave: The default user stylesheet has been remamed to `~/.atom/styles.css`, you should rename your `~/.atom/user.css` file after updating
- :new::green_heart:  The app icon is now the color green

### For Developers
- :coffee::one::seven:  Upgraded to CoffeeScript 1.7.0
- :honey_pot::honeybee: The exported `SelectList` class was renamed to `SelectListView`

name: Cadmium
body:
### For Users
- :symbols::bug: Find and Replace inputs treat `\t`, `\r`, `\n` and `\\` as their unescaped equivalents
- :recycle::eyes: Changes to `~/.atom/user.less` now automatically reload, no more refreshing required
- :black_nib::bug: Fixed an issue with the GitHub sign in dialog not working
- :page_with_curl::eyes: Code folding can be toggled from the gutter to the left of the editor
- :1234::x: The previous item is now activated when closing a tab, rather than the next
- :link::earth_americas: `[text][link-name]` style markdown links can now be opened using `ctrl-shift-o`
- :open_file_folder::bug: Fixed an issue opening symlink'ed folders

name: Silver
body:
### For Users
- :three::one: Atom is now built on top of Chrome 31
- :black_square_button::white_square_button: Panes no longer close by default when all tabs are closed
- :shoe::bug: Fixed a bug where find highlights could be rendered incorrectly

name: Palladium
body:
### For Users
- :bug::koko: Fixed a bug causing the matching bracket highlights not to display
- :bug::mouse: Fixed a bug causing tooltips not to display
- :floppy_disk::chart_with_downwards_trend: The Atom download is now 30MB smaller

### For Developers
- The bundled `apm` tool now has a `login` command if you are publishing a package and haven't logged into Atom yet.

name: Rhodium
body:
### For Users
- :new::key: `cmd-l` selects the current line and pressing it again expands the selection to the next line
- :new::key: `cmd-shift-l` splits a multi-line selection into multiple single-line selections
- :new::key: `cmd-d` finds and selects the next occurrence of the selected word or word under the cursor
- :new::key: `cmd-ctrl-g` finds and selects all occurrences of the selected word or word under the cursor
- :new::key: `cmd-ctrl-alt-l` reloads Atom (used to be `cmd-ctrl-alt-r`)
- :new::key: `ctrl-g` goes to a specific line number (used to be `cmd-l`)
- :new::key: `ctrl-shift-l` changes the current grammar (used to be `cmd-shift-l`)
- :new::key: The Git/GitHub related commands now use the `alt-g` prefix instead of `ctrl-g`, such as `alt-g up` to move to the previous diff and `alt-g b` to blame the current file.
- :mag_right::dash: Fuzzy finder now opens quicker and filters in a third of the time
- :syringe::fax: Syntax highlighting is now much faster, over 50% faster for JavaScript files specifically
- :non-potable_water::non-potable_water: Fixed some major issues with memory consumption. GC pauses should be less frequent now
- :arrows_counterclockwise::eyes: Changes to `~/.atom/keymap.coffee` automatically reload, no more refreshing required
- :hourglass::gun: Packages now activate faster decreasing Atom's startup time

### For Developers
- `atom.on 'uncaught-error'` will trigger when an uncaught Javascript error is thrown.
- Added `WorkspaceView::prependToTop/Right/Bottom/Left` and `WorkspaceView::appendToTop/Right/Bottom/Left` for adding tool panels. This is available via the `atom.workspaceView` global.

name: Ruthenium
body:
### For Users
- :black_nib::high_brightness: HTML entities now highlight in GitHub Flavored Markdown files.
- :recycle::bug: Fixed an issue with the fuzzy finder re-indexing incorrectly when reopening.
- :twisted_rightwards_arrows::id: The [wrap-guide](https://github.com/atom/wrap-guide) package now uses `wrap-guide` as its config prefix instead of `wrapGuide` to be consistent with other packages. All `wrapGuide.columns` config settings should be updated to `wrap-guide.columns`.
- :evergreen_tree::mountain_cableway: Tree view no longer automatically shrinks and expands as your open/close folders.
- :evergreen_tree::ghost: The `tree-view.hideIgnoredNames` settings can now be used to hide file/folders in the tree view that match the `core.ignoredNames` setting, such as `.git`.
- :chart_with_upwards_trend::bug: Fixed an issue with the [editor-stats](https://github.com/atom/editor-stats) package not opening.
- :evergreen_tree::toilet: Fixed and issue with folders collapsing in the [tree-view](https://github.com/atom/tree-view) when a file/folder was added.
- :runner::fire: The Movement menu has been removed.

### For Developers
- :tent::bug: Fixed an issue with the menu file generated from running `Package Generator: Generate Package` or `apm init --package` not being parseable.
- :do_not_litter: Added a `script/clean` command to delete node_modules, apm cache, compile cache, etc.

name: Technetium
body:
### For Users
- :mouse::bug: Fixed a bug causing incorrect cursor movement and text insertion in files with hard tabs `\t`.
- :floppy_disk::bug: Fixed a bug with autosaving causing an error for untitled buffers that had unsaved changes..
- :link::bug: Help > Documentation menu now opens correct URL.
- :door::bug: Fixed a bug preventing the `Settings View: Change Themes` command from opening.
- :dart::straight_ruler: Added `ctrl-g down/up` keyboard shortcuts to jump to the next/previous diff hunk in the open editor.

### For Developers
- New `atom.getGitHubAuthToken()` and `atom.setGitHubAuthToken(token)` APIs to access and change the GitHub OAuth token stored in the keychain, see #1240.
- Syntax themes can now specify a `syntax-variables.less` file similar to `ui-variables.less`, see #1246.

name: Molybdenum
body:
### For Users
- :door::bug: Fixed an issue with the welcome page not opening on first run.
- :wrench::bug: Fixed an issue with `script/build` failing with a missing auth token error.

### For Developers
- :running_shirt_with_sash: `script/install-cli` was added to install the `atom` and `apm` commands.
- :no_entry: A dialog is now display when trying to open dev windows without having atom/atom cloned to `~/github/atom`.

name: Niobium
body:
### For Users
- :lock_with_ink_pen::bug: Fixed a bug with the GitHub sign in dialog not working.
- :loop::bug: Fixed an infinite loop parsing ERB syntax such as `<%>`.

name: Zirconium
body:
### For Users
- :camera: A feedback tool is now included, click the :zap: icon on the status bar to let us know how you are feeling.

### For Developers
- All the Atom shims to old deprecated APIs have been removed, see #1166 and #1169 for more details.
- Some CSS ids were changed to be classes, see #1184 for more details.

name: Yttrium
body:
### For Users
- :musical_keyboard: Custom keymap configuration has changed.
  - If you're using `body` in your keymaps you should switch it to `.workspace`
  - If you're using `meta` to represent command it should now be switched to `cmd`

### For Developers
- :neutral_face: The shims to deprecated APIs have been removed, see #1126.
- :key: Keymap configuration has changed.
  - If you're using `body` in your keymaps you should switch it to `.workspace`
  - If you're using `meta` to represent command it should now be switched to `cmd`

name: Strontium
body:
## For Users
-  :seat::bug: Fixed an issue with editors not reopening in certain cases.

name: Rubidium
body: This release was accidental and did not include anything noteworthy in it.

name: Krypton
body:
### For Users
- :clipboard::bug: Fixed an issue with pasting certain words such as `constructor` in the editor.
- :black_large_square::bug: Fixed an issue with the editor going blank when focused.
- :dancers::bug: Fixed an issue with bracket pair highlights not going away when deleting a bracket.

name: Bromine
body:
### For Users
- :tractor::dash: Editors now open faster and take up less memory.
- :bookmark_tabs::sparkles: Better looking tabs.
- :headphones::bug: Soft wrap now updates when the editor's size changes, splits are open, etc.
- :coffee::bug: CoffeeScript regexes now syntax highlight correctly when they contain `\`.
- :scroll::bug: Undo/redo now scrolls the editor to the location of the change.
- :white_medium_small_square::bug: Git support and syntax highlighting now works on Windows.

name: Selenium
body:
### For Users
- :file_folder::mag:  Project find now displays results in a tab in the main editor area.
- :arrows_counterclockwise::bug: Fixed a bug where editors weren't reopened on startup.
- :bookmark_tabs::bug: Fixed a bug where hard tabs could not be enabled on the editor.
- :package::bug: Fixed a bug where the Settings view did not display available packages.

### For Package Developers
- `.cson` is now a valid grammar extension.

name: Arsenic
body:
### For Users
- :non-potable_water: :racehorse: Faster startup and plugged some memory leaks
- :dash::white_large_square: Atom can now be built on Windows
- :star::key: Store user keymaps in `~/.atom/keymap.cson`
- :ghost::bug: Command palette (`cmd-p`) no longer missing events when no editors are open
- :hash::exclamation: Files starting with `#!/usr/bin/env node` now highlight as JavaScript by default
- :speech_balloon::bug: Commenting lines no longer deletes the first character of the line

name: Germanium
body:
### For Users
- :link: Links to collaboration URLs now properly open.
- :rocket: Launching Atom from the dock now opens an untitled editor.
- :file_folder:  Project subfolders now open in a new window when opened from the command line.
- :deciduous_tree: Tree view no longer hides Git ignored files when the current project is a subfolder in a Git repository.
- :speedboat::dash: Much improved scrolling/cursor performance.
- :globe_with_meridians: Menus to expose most of Atom's functionality.
- :no_entry_sign: Atom no longer crashes on large files (warns for files larger than 1 MB) or when loading broken packages.
- :key: Default keybindings now closely mirror Sublime.

### For Package Developers
- You can now have a `urlMain` in your `package.json` which will be used as the bootstrap script for all urls opened with your package name as the host, such as `atom://collaboration/12345`.
- You can now add menu items to global menus by specifying the appropriate information in cson menu files included in your `menus` directory like so:

``` coffeescript
'menu': [
  {
    'label': 'View'
    'submenu': [
      {
        'label': 'Toggle Treeview'
        'command': 'tree-view:toggle'
      }
    ]
  }
]
```
- Upgraded jQuery to 2.0.3
- If you're currently using `{_} = require 'atom'` and then calling `_.nextTick` you should use node's `setImmediate` instead.
- Packages are now hosted on `atom.io` so you'll need to remove the `publishConfig` key from your package.json and replace it with `"private": true` (which is a precaution to prevent packages from accidentally being published to [npmjs.org](http://npmjs.org)).

name: Gallium
body:
### For Users
- Fix :bug: using the _GitHub: Open_ (`ctrl-g o`) command

name: Zinc
body:
### For Users
- Fixed a :bug: in collaboration where joining a session would fail.
- Added `ctrl-g c` (_GitHub: Copy Url_ from `cmd-p`) which copies a GitHub URL to the clipboard for the current file and line number.

name: Copper
body:
### For Users
- Renaming/deleting files/folders is now possible from the tree view context menu.
- Find and replace highlights matches correctly for long lines.
- Find and replace now stores the history of what you replaced and where you searched.
- Collaboration no longer errors when you try to start it from project with no Git repository.
- Errors no longer popup when you start Atom and you aren't online.

### For Package Developers
- `apm test` is now available, to quickly run atom tests from the command line. Note atom must still be installed and accessible from your command line for this to work.
- :closed_book: API Change, globals are deprecated and should now be accessed from the `atom` object. See #881 for details.

name: Nickel
body: - Safely ignore non-existent themes.

name: Cobalt
body:
### For Users
- Numerous speedups, atom should load more quickly now.
- Collaboration is now working (and accepts 2FA logins).
- Brand new find and replace package
  - Substantially faster for large code bases
  - Update search results in real-time
  - Project search and replace
- Themes are now packages, so you can install them from apm.
- You can open a file at a specific line from the command line, like so `atom file.js:10`
- IME support for international users.
- Right click on a spelling correction to bring up suggestions.
- The `solarized-dark-syntax` theme is now included by default.
- The `base16-tomorrow-dark-theme` theme is also included.
- There is a new `timecop` package which allows you to investigate slow packages.
- Double-clicking between a word/non-word boundary now selects the word rather than the adjacent non-word characters.

### For Package Developers
- :closed_book: Changed API, public classes are now exported using a single require statement, `{Editor} = require 'atom'`
- :green_book: Added an API, the `menus` folder allows packages to specify their own context menu commands.
- Default themes are now based on bootstrap and contain `ui-variables` so that 3rd party themes can better integrate with base UI themes. 
- `apm init` now allows for the generation of packages and themes
- `ui-demo` package for seeing what ui styles are available for use.

### How you can help
- We'd really like feedback regarding collaboration. If you find a bug, please file an issue on the atom/collaboration repository. If you have a question or a suggestion feel free to drop into the atom chat room and ask away.
